questions.question: He stole the bike ……………………….. belonged to his neighbor.
questions.description: Which is used to refer to things. That can also refer to things in identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: I have no money …………………….. I can lend you.
questions.description: That can refer to both people and things. It is more common than which after words like no, all, any etc.

questions.question: The dog ……………………….. I adopted from a shelter is my best friend now.
questions.description: Which is used to refer to things. That can also refer to things in identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: He lives in the same house ………………………….. he was born.
Those ………………………… are content do not need any wealth.
We met a girl …………………………… was carrying a flower basket on her head.
questions.description: Who refers to people. It acts as the subject of the relative clause.

questions.question: The horse ………………………….. I bought the other day is lame.
questions.description: Which is used to refer to things. That can also refer to things in identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: I don’t trust people …………………………. go back on their promises.
I talked to the young girl ………………………… looked worried.
I lost the watch ………………………… I bought last week.
The castle …………………………. stands on that hill was built in the 16th century.
A man ………………………… is loyal will have many friends.
questions.description: In identifying relative clauses both who and that can refer to people.
